content.text:
I'm ready to help you explore the codebase and design implementation plans. I understand that I'm in READ-ONLY mode and can only explore the codebase, not modify any files.

Let me start by getting oriented with the project structure:

<bash>
find /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent -type f -name "*.rs" -o -name "*.go" -o -name "*.ts" -o -name "*.tsx" | head -30
</bash>

<bash>
ls -la /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent/
</bash>

<bash>
cat /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent/README.md 2>/dev/null || echo "No README found"
</bash>

I can see this is a personal agent project with:
- A Tauri desktop application (`packages/desktop/src-tauri`)
- A React UI (`packages/desktop/ui`)
- A Go backend (`go-backend`)
- A website component

The git status shows recent work on:
- Agent capabilities and settings
- Task scheduling
- New tools (feedback, screenshot)
- Storage migrations
- Onboarding functionality

I'm ready to help you design and plan implementations. What requirements would you like me to work on?
